summary: I promised myself I’d at least do one piece a month.  I don’t feel inspired enough to bring this beyond my sketchy nonsense. ...
caption: I promised myself I’d at least do one piece a month.  I don’t feel inspired enough to bring this beyond my sketchy nonsense.  But eh here have the best mentor in FFXIV.  I’d die for Sidurgu & he’d let me.

summary:
2016 vs 2019
Buckle down kids because I'm gonna get sentimental.
I remember getting a decent art program the same time there was...
body:
2016 vs 2019

Buckle down kids because I’m gonna get sentimental.

I remember getting a decent art program the same time there was a goosebumpsona art challenge going on and I drew this for one of the prompts when I finally got the art program (it was an extremely outdated manga studio because the hand-me-down junk computer that didn’t even have internet that I was at the time couldn’t handle anything updated) and I was so proud of this piece because it was my first digital art piece that wasn’t fucked up by a shitty bootleg program. I was 16, brand new to digital art, I had no clue how to use the program, but when I drew this piece I was so proud of it.

Now that I’ve been using digital art for a bit and with the help of my amazing girlfriend @artsy-gingersnap I have a better program (paint tool sai ver 2), a better computer (thanks to my grandparents) and a better grasp at how to draw digitally, along with my own art growth. Do I cringe at this piece now when I look at it? Of course I do, because I’ve grown so much since then. But still, this piece meant so much to me back then, and I was still growing as an artist (and I still am). The improvement in three years is absolutely crazy and I can say that I’m proud at all the progress I’ve made.

Remember where you came from, and remember that if you don’t like where you’re at now, you can only get better 💚
